briefTitle: Asthma Clinical Research Network (ACRN) Trial - Macrolides in Asthma (MIA)
officialTitle: Asthma Clinical Research Network (ACRN) Trial - Macrolides in Asthma (MIA)
summary: Asthma can be caused by a variety of factors, including tobacco smoke, allergens, and respiratory airway infections. Many people use inhaled corticosteroid medications to treat their symptoms. These medications, however, are not effective for everyone. Clarithromycin is an antibiotic that may effectively treat asthma in these individuals. This study will evaluate the effectiveness of clarithromycin at controlling asthma symptoms.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Measured every four weeks during the 16-week treatment period, with the change (week 16 minus baseline) as the primary outcome
